intro: Leptonychia bampsii var. ituriensis, commonly known as the Ituri fern, is a rare and striking plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that display a unique coloration pattern. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires high levels of moisture and organic-rich soil. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are typically arranged in a distinctive pattern along the undersides of its leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
